children.subject:
At this point in time, the only classes I know of that are going to webcast are CS 61A, 61B, and CS 70 because they are in lecture rooms smaller than the enrollment capacity. That's not to say others won't webcast - it's simply that we have no mechanism for knowing that information without emailing the profs to compile a list & I'm still too busy setting up classes to do that work yet.

Please keep in mind that Spring 2022 is slated to be IN PERSON ONLY instruction so webcasting is optional unless the class exceeds the room capacity.
But for some classes which allow time conflicts, does it mean these classes will have webcasts?
No - you cannot assume that. I haven't updated the time conflict info from last Spring yet. And even when I do, I wouldn't make that assumption.
Can we have an idea about which class will be webcast and which won't be?
It is EXTREMELY unlikely that CS 270 will be offered in Spring 2022.
Is there any possibility that CS 270 will be offered?
CS 162 and EECS 126 also conflict with each other and I have the same question since this combo is semi common among students
<md>+1 on this concern, was planning on taking both</md>

Given how challenging it is to get rooms, I highly doubt these classes will change times. I can only speak for CS classes. I need to double check with instructors for Spring 2022 still but suspect that CS 186/189 conflict will be okay & allow time conflicts & alternate finals. Do NOT take that as a certainty however & be sure to check the CLASS NOTES for each class before you enroll. I promise to have that information updated by Oct 11 when phase 1 enrollment begins.

CS 162 & EECS 126 might be more challenging. It just depends on the faculty's willingness to allow time conflict each semester. Often CS 162 does NOT allow time conflicts but I haven't checked yet so stay tuned for more information on that class.

With regards to 186 and 189, if both of them continue to be slotted for the same time, does that mean I could not take them both next semester due to conflicts in the final time (for example).

Or is there a chance their times will be moved?
I’m still able to see 61B on the schedule, however, I think there’s still an error because the capacity is set to 481 and the waitlist capacity it set to 1545.
+1: I see it on the draft schedule but not on classes.berkeley.edu.

Yes - I just worked out some details & have added it to the schedule.

Please keep in mind 2 things:

1. this class will NOT expand enrollment

2. I still need to confirm if Prof Canny will allow time conflicts or not for Spring 2022.
Has this been updated on the Berkeley Class Schedule?
yes, I can see it
Is there any possibility that CS 160 will be offered?
That is the current guidance so I'm going to say yes - plan on in-person only.
Will EE and CS classes offer exams and office hours only in person?

highly unlikely. I can only speak for CS 61B really, but it's Prof Hilfinger teaching again & he doesn't allow time conflicts because he refuses to offer alternate exams. My suspicion is that EECS 16B will continue to take a similar no time conflict position.
do you think cs61b and eecs16b will be updated to allow time enrollment conflicts? I have some other classes I was planning to take that are scheduled during their lecture times

It's too soon to know. It's at the faculty discretion each semester and I haven't asked this Spring's faculty yet. I will contact faculty between now & before enrollment goes live on Oct 11th so check back on that one. I update the CLASS NOTES for each class to indicate if time conflicts are allowed or now.
Will cs 170 allow for time conflicts next semester?
No - it's likely an error I need to fix. Thanks for catching that. :-)
Ok, thank you Cindy!
Hello, I noticed that there are two separate lecture listings for CS 152 in the Academic Guide, is this intentional? Appreciate any clarification.
Nevermind, it looks like 3:30-5 is the correct time
Sorry but you will have to email ds-advising@berkeley.edu with that question. I know nothing about DS classes.

This may be out of scope since I’m asking about Data C100, but I guess since it’s cross listed with CS you may be able to help. 

Basically, on the calcentral scheduler it shows that the data 100 lecture is 9:30-11am T/Th, however, on the Berkeley class schedule it shows that the lecture is 3:30-5pm T/Th. 

Which one is correct?
For these questions, I recommend that you check on www.berkeleytime.com to see historical enrollment info.
How often is 267 offered generally? Also 194-15?

I would not count on it. Budget constraints continue. Sorry for the bad news.

As we have done in F21, as we find additional pockets of funding, we will expand some classes in small ways but not like before.
Generally speaking, most upper div classes with enrollment capacity far smaller than what's being offered this (Fa21) semester is likely going to increase right?
No, that class will definitely not be offered in SP22.
Will CS168 be offered with any chance?

I would not have worded it that way but yes. Anything in the Schedule planner that is visible will be offered BUT you should check back later to see if time conflicts are allowed.

As I'm resolving issues with class setup, I'm editing my original post to keep the list of 'problem classes' up to date.
Thanks for the heads up! Just to confirm, if I can find a course in the schedule planner, and it is not listed above, can I assume that it will be offered next semester?
Or at least the EECS16a lectures?
You will have to ask the EE Scheduler that question. This thread is for CompSci classes. Sorry.
Will EECS16a or Eng26 allow time conflict enrollment?
Yes - try looking again. There can be a delay between when I mark it to be displayed & you see it in CalCentral.
Will CS70 be offered in the spring? I can’t seem to see it for spring 22, just previous semesters.
zero
What is the likelihood of CS164 being offered in Spring? (Is it above zero?)
when do phase 1 enrollments begin?

I cannot say if the CS 182 situation will be resolved before phase 1 enrollment starts on Oct 11th. We are still looking for someone to teach the class & that can take any amount of time. (Faculty leaves have necessitated some shuffling with regards to who teaches which class in Spring.)
so would you recommend not registering for 182 during phase 1?
The class enrollment will start in less than a week, can we have an update on the cs182?

Best I can say is they are still looking for someone to teach it. Until we have someone hired, I cannot open the class for enrollment. If you do see it in the system but it says Dept Consent required - that means we've temporarily closed enrollments but intend to offer the class.

Will we know for sure whether CS 182 will be offered or not before phase 1 enrollments begin?

I am a senior graduating in Spring 2022 and was planning on taking that class for my design requirement. However, if known that it won't be offered for sure I will have to enroll in a different upper div to satisfy my design requirement.
No, it alternates with CS 169L that we are offering in Spring.
Is there a chance that CS 169A will be offered next semester?
see update in original post above: CS 194-035 will NOT be offered in SP22 since the instructor is on leave.
Is CS 194-35 Data Engineering going to be offered? It is listed on the draft schedule so was curious.
<md>https://piazza.com/class/hyq0br1u3kx7dg?cid=15738_f13</md>
Cindy responded above it will definitely not be offered in SP2022
What is the likelihood of CS168 being offered in Spring? (Is it above zero?)
I cannot answer that question because I only deal with CompSci classes. You should email ee-scheduling@berkeley.edu.
EE227c looks like it doesn't have an instructor yet; is that related to the time? and is the time slot for this class set in stone? (8am)
To the best of our ability - yes. We've booked rooms & times & notified faculty. Sometimes we get late requests for changes but if it's public info, it's up to date.
Have the times for EE and CS classes been finalized yet?

Hey all - I haven't had a chance to reach out to any faculty re: Special Topics classes yet. You will just have to wait for that information. There are other time-sensitive issues I need to resolve before I can get to this work.
Is CS294-158 (Deep Unsupervised Learning) still being offered in SP22? It remains on the listing on CS Draft Schedule website but not on CalCentral.

It's too soon to know that information. CS 186 WILL be in person lecture for SP22 but I still need to follow up to ask about time conflicts & webcasting.

Please keep in mind that the schedule went live to you all earlier than it has in the past & there was just no way for me to get everything updated by the time it went live while I was still dealing with F21 add/drops.

I plan to poll faculty for the time conflict details this weekend & hopefully will be able to have everything current for SP22 by the middle of this coming week.

In CS 186's class notes on the course catalog, it mentions that "this class will have web-based lecture," so can we be allowed schedule conflicts for lectures at the same time (for example, CS 189)? Right now I can't choose both classes at the same time due to this conflict, but if CS 186 will continue to have online lectures, I was wondering if students can be made to allow enrollment in both classes.
Please keep in mind this thread is around CS classes & I don't think the EE Scheduler reads this thread. You should email this question to ee-scheduling@berkeley.edu.
It seems that EE 122 has two different lecture times on T/Th (for a total of 6 hours of lecture per week instead of 3). If this is incorrect, which time slot is correct?
Unless Campus says otherwise, yes - that is what we mean. Absolutely no remote sections for any classes on campus unless the class has already been approved to be offered online (example: CS 186)

Regarding class formats - at this time ALL classes will be offered in-person only, with no remote sections.

Do you mean there are absolutely no remote sections for any EE/CS classes?

Since this thread is for CompSci classes, I have no idea. But you might be able to find that information if you look up the class on classes.berkeley.edu. Otherwise, I recommend you check the Math dept website to see if they have any enrollment info published.
Math H110 only offered in the fall.

Will Edward Frenkel be teaching Math 110 or Math 110H Spring 2022?

Thanks in advance.
No, I would go with the time for Physics & Chem. The hazard of cross listed classes is that sometimes the scheduler's don't get to talk to each other right away.
For CS c191, it differs from the time for Physics and Chem. Do we know if the CS version is the right one or are there three different lectures for SP22?

I'm sorry to say but at this point I do not believe we are offering any CS 194 classes in Spring semester. Some faculty who had planned to teach are on leave.

We intended to offer CS 194 but are having a hard time finding someone to teach it this coming semester so we've had to pull it off the schedule. If we manage to find someone to teach, I'll add it back to the schedule later.
Does this apply to 294’s as well? Aren’t most classes that grad students take usually 294’s?
The majority of the 294 classes often are requested after enrollment starts. I've got 4 that I'm making visible later today.
<md>Is there an ETA on when the CS 194 classes will be released?</md>

Is EE C291E / ME C290S being taught Spring 2022 or in the future? The catalog indicates it is, but classes.berkeley.edu and https://www2.eecs.berkeley.edu/Scheduling/EE/schedule-next.html do not show it.




ee-scheduling@berkeley.edu indicated it will NOT be taught this Spring.
It will be offered but we are still trying to figure out the seat allocation. I expect it will re-appear late this afternoon.
To follow up here - will the graduate equivalent course, CS260, be offered next semester?
CS 160 has been hidden - does that mean that it may not be offered?
You need to email ee-scheduling@berkeley.edu for that info. If someone does, can they share the info here? I don't think that scheduler is on this piazza.
<md>It looks like it's on the website now. Thanks!</md>
<md>Is 16B going to have reserved seats? If so, when will they be shown on the class schedule website?</md>

The system requires you to get a permission code from the instructor to be able to enroll into grad classes.

When you see the error message saying it's a CAREER issue, that's what the error means.

Please keep in mind that we do not have any of the combined sections set up yet so check back next week for updates on those classes. But the rest of the grad classes should be ready to accept the permission codes you get from faculty.
Can undergrad students get into 200 level courses (eg: CS 280), or is there some special process we have to go through to get permission to enroll in those?
Is CS 281A offered? It's listed on the ASE application, but not anywhere else.
Will CS 280 be offered next semester?
Shewchuk doesn't normally do this
Will CS189 enforce prerequisites (Math 53, CS70/Equivalent, EE16A/16B/equivalent) Spring semester by dropping students who don't fulfill them?

history.content:
Tomorrow the Spring 2022 schedule goes live. Unfortunately, many unknowns still exist behind the scenes and rather than give you FALSE information, I've chosen to hide classes whose setup is not yet complete. The list below covers the classes that we intend to offer but I cannot yet list. Once I have resolved the behind-the-scenes issues, I will post these classes as soon as I am able.

CS 294 - Special Topics series

CS 298 - seminars

=================

CS 182/282A - There is uncertainty whether this class will be offered during Sp22 so please keep watching CalCentral or classes.berkeley.edu for updates. For now, I would not include that in your Spring 2022 planning, but know we are working on it.

Regarding class formats - at this time ALL classes will be offered in-person only, with no remote sections.

9/28 UPDATE: CS 194-035 will NOT be offered in SP22 since the instructor is on leave.
history.subject: SP22: Schedule notes...I've had to hide some of our classes temporarily
